Generation I.Red: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
Generation I.Yellow: Loves freezing cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14F degrees .
Generation I.Stadium: It boasts a thick hide covered with light blue fur. It plows through ice floes even in water 40 degrees below 0.

Generation II.Gold: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
Generation II.Silver: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
Generation II.Crystal: The light blue fur that covers it keeps it protected against the cold. It loves iceberg-filled oceans.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
Generation III.Sapphire: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
Generation III.Emerald: Seel hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
Generation III.FireRed: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation III.LeafGreen: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick icebergs.

Generation IV.Diamond: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Generation IV.Pearl: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Generation IV.Platinum: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.

Generation V.Black: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Generation V.White: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Generation V.Black 2: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
Generation V.White 2: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.

Generation VI.X: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Generation VI.Y: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit .

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: This Pokémon lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: This Pokémon lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The protrusion on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
Generation IX.Violet: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.

Generation I.Blue: Seafoam Islands Trade Ponyta at the Pokémon Lab on Cinnabar Island

Generation III.LeafGreen: Seafoam Islands , Icefall Cave Trade Ponyta at the Pokémon Lab on Cinnabar Island
